2.labelPos: No user supplied inputs are vulnerable to SQL injection
2.labelNeg: Some user supplied inputs are vulnerable to SQL injection
riskHistory:
SQL injection may be used by malicious peoples to read all the content of your database.
Depending on the database configuration and on the injected SQL query, SQL injections are often allowing database writing.
In some case SQL injection may also lead to server side code execution.
2.risk:
SQL injection may be used by malicious peoples to read all the content of your database.
Depending on the database configuration and on the injected SQL query, SQL injections are often allowing database writing.
In some case SQL injection may also lead to server side code execution.
2.observ: Some user supplied inputs are inefficiently filtered and can be used to execute some SQL code.
2.reco:
Never trust user supplied inputs, apply some filtering before using them into SQL queries.
Use SQL prepared statements instead of regular queries.
2.name: SQL Injection
recoHistory:
Never trust user supplied inputs, apply some filtering before using them into SQL queries.
Use SQL prepared statements instead of regular queries.
observHistory: Some user supplied inputs are inefficiently filtered and can be used to execute some SQL code.

3.labelPos: No user supplied inputs are vulnerable to Cross-Site-Scripting (XSS)
3.labelNeg: Some user supplied inputs are vulnerable to Cross-Site-Scripting (XSS)
riskHistory:
XSS may be used by malicious peoples to have some client-side code execution.
This code execution can be used for example to steal user's session, to steal user's sensitives data or to perform some actions using his authorizations.
3.risk:
XSS may be used by malicious peoples to have some client-side code execution.
This code execution can be used for example to steal user's session, to steal user's sensitives data or to perform some actions using his authorizations.
3.observ: Some user supplied inputs are inefficiently filtered and can be used to inject some client-side executable code into web pages.
3.reco: Never trust user supplied inputs, apply some filtering before including them into web pages.
3.name: XSS
recoHistory: Never trust user supplied inputs, apply some filtering before including them into web pages.
observHistory: Some user supplied inputs are inefficiently filtered and can be used to inject some client-side executable code into web pages.
